DOC.brief_summary: Laryngeal mask airway ( LMA ) fit laryngeal inlet show effective ventilating newborn birth . The LMA may consider alternative FM positive pressure ventilation ( PPV ) among newborns weigh > 2000 g deliver > 34 week ' gestation . A recent , quasi-experimental study provide feasibility , efficacy safety use LMA neonatal resuscitation . However , study LMA use provide PPV neonatal resuscitation still limit . There publish clinical randomize trial evaluate LMA compare FM neonatal resuscitation . Hypothesis : Our hypothesis base assumption ventilate newborn need PPV LMA effective ventilating FM decrease proportion resuscitate newborn need ETT . Objective : To compare effectiveness LMA FM ventilation newborn need PPV birth . Design / Methods : An open , prospective , randomize , single center , clinical trial . Intervention : PPV perform LMA ( intervention group ) FM ( control group ) infant newborn weigh > 2000 g deliver > 34 week gestation . Primary outcome variable : Proportion newborn need endotracheal intubation . Secondary outcome measure : Apgar score 5 minute , heart rate 60 , 90 second 5 10 minute , time first breath , duration PPV , proportion infant need chest compression , drug death within 1 week and/or presence HIE , grade II III , accord modification Sarnat Sarnat.2,10 According classification , HIE grade I ( mild ) include irritability , hyperalertness , mild hypotonia , poor sucking ; grade II ( moderate ) include lethargy , seizure , mark abnormality tone , requirement tube feeding ; grade III ( severe ) include coma , prolonged seizure , severe hypotonia , failure maintain spontaneous respiration . The following data collect resuscitation : ( 1 ) Apgar score 1 min 5 min birth ; ( 2 ) LMA insertion time , rate successful insertion first attempt , number attempt require insert LMA successfully ; ( 3 ) duration resuscitation : response time ( time period start LMA resuscitation achieve effective response ) , ventilation time ; ( 4 ) adverse effect resuscitation .
DOC.brief_title: Supreme-LMA Neonatal Resuscitation : Prospective , Randomized Single-center Study
